intro: Terminalia tetrandra, commonly known as African snowball, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its showy, white, spherical flower clusters that appear at the ends of branches. The tree has smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in local medicine.
